description: large bowl with abstract designs on top, outside with incised bands below; brown with beige designs; beige inside
text: This bowl is an extraordinarily large example of the Scheiers' work. It is part of a group of pots they produced in the 1950s with abstract decoration.  Modern artists such as Paul Klee were an influence on Ed and Mary at this time, and Ed deftly translated similar abstract linear patterns onto these sizable forms, creating a three-dimensional canvas.
title: Bowl with abstract design
